metadata.title: CVE-2010-3692 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Directory traversal vulnerability in the callback function in client.php inphpCAS before 1.1.3, when proxy mode is enabled, allows remote attackers tocreate or overwrite arbitrary files via directory traversal sequences in aProxy Granting Ticket IOU (PGTiou) parameter.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2010-3692` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

glpi - 0.80.7-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

moodle - 1.9.9.dfsg2-5
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: glpi package in esm-apps/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.80.7-1').
moodle package in esm-apps/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.9.9.dfsg2-5').
